name: Recyclable Wind Turbine Blades
description: Qualitative scoping for recyclable composite wind turbine blades at low TRL.
scoping_notes: Focus on early-stage design trade-offs: recyclable thermoplastic composites vs. conventional thermoset blades.

Climate change.note: Thermoplastic production has higher footprint than thermosets.

Health and safety (workers).note: Standard composite handling, some chemical risks.

Public commitment to sustainability issu.note: Strong narrative of recyclability in renewable energy sector.

Local employment (local community).note: Some jobs in local manufacturing plants.

Complexity of production process.note: More complex than thermosets (higher temperature, tooling).

Raw material cost.note: More expensive polymers than conventional resins.

Cost of final product.note: Blade cost expected to be higher initially.

Climate change.note: Similar energy intensity to conventional manufacturing.

Resource use, fossils.note: High energy demand and fossil-derived electricity in some regions.

Land Use.note: Design for recyclability not yet proven at manufacturing stage.

Health and safety (workers).note: High temperature processing may increase risks.

Public commitment to sustainability issu.note: Branding value of recyclable blades for OEMs.

Complexity of production process.note: Manufacturing is more challenging with thermoplastics.

Cost of final product.note: Cost premiums remain significant at TRL 3.

Climate change.note: No major differences expected during operation.

Resource use, fossils.note: No major differences compared to conventional blades.

Health and safety (workers).note: Similar maintenance conditions as standard blades.

Public commitment to sustainability issu.note: No additional benefit at O&M phase.

Raw material cost.note: No cost differences at O&M phase.

Resource use, fossils.note: Recovered material can displace virgin polymer.

Land Use.note: Clear benefit over current non-recyclable thermoset blades.

Public commitment to sustainability issu.note: Strong societal value in solving blade waste challenge.

Local employment (local community).note: New recycling industry can create local jobs.

Raw material cost.note: Secondary material streams can lower cost long-term.

Cost of final product.note: Recycling may reduce life-cycle cost balance.

core_function: Enable wind energy generation with recyclable blades.
functional_unit: One 60-meter wind turbine blade designed for 20 years of operation, recyclable at end-of-life.
